briefdescription.para: Type of scale used, raw, scale by the maximum, or scale by the shoulder.
List of pointers on the threads which have to be suppress when this object is destroy.
True if the correlation information needed to draw the correlograms are available.
List of pairs of clusters for which a correlogram has to be drawn.
size of the bins to use in the correlograms, given in miliseconds
Time frame use to compute the correlograms, given in miliseconds.
Minimal abscissa in window coordinate.
Maximal abscissa in window coordinate.
Minimal ordinate in window coordinate.
Maximal ordinate in window coordinate.
The width border.
The height border.
The width of a bins.
Abscissa space between two correlograms.
Ordinate space between two correlograms.
Size in pixels corresponding to the maximale value of a correlogram.
Factor use to calculate the ordinate value to been drawn.

detaileddescription.para: The factor equals YsizeForMaxAmp multipled by a zoom factor.

briefdescription.para: The delta between the starting abscisses of two correlograms.
Number of bins per correlogram (2k + 1).
List of pairs corresponding to clusters to update.
Boolean indicating if a shoulder line has to be drawn on the correlograms.
Step in pixels between two tick marks.
Number of tick marks in a time window.
Abscissa of the tick mark for the center bin (time = 0).
Map of firing rate for the autocorrelograms.
True if the view has been zoomed, false ohterwise.
True if the widget is about to be deleted, false otherwise.
The region representing the area to print.
Border on the left and right sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
Border on the top and bottom sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).

memberdef.name: CorrelationView

briefdescription.para: Signals that the widget is about to be deleted.
Returns the size of the bins to use in the correlograms, given in miliseconds.
Returns the time frame use to compute the correlograms, given in miliseconds.
Returns the type of scale used to present the correlation data.
Returns a boolean indicating if a doted line is drawn at the shoulder level of the correlograms.

simplesect.para: true if a line is drawn, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: cluster Id for which the color have changed.
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

Which impose to redraw everything

briefdescription.para: Changes the current mode, call by a selection of a tool.

parameterdescription.para: new mode of drawing (selection or zoom)

briefdescription.para: Sets the mode of presentation to raw mode, meaning that the value of each bin in a correlogram will be the computed value.
Sets the mode of presentation to raw mode, meaning that the value of each bin in a correlogram will be the computed value scale by the maximum value.
Sets the mode of presentation to raw mode, meaning that the value of each bin in a correlogram will be the computed value scale by the shoulder value.
Changes the size of the bins and the size of the time frame used to compute the correlograms.
Increase of the amplitude of the correlograms.
Decrease of the amplitude of the correlograms.
Enables the caller to know if there is any thread running launch by the view.
Update the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

detaileddescription.para:
This method is call only during an undo otherwise the updateClusters is call. There are 2 functions in order to reduce the number of clusters to draw whenever possible.
modifiedClusters
list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Update the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
modifiedClusters
list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
isModifiedByDeletion
true if the clusters of modifiedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).

briefdescription.para: Update the presentation of a doted line at the shoulder level.

detaileddescription.para:
If b is true a line will be drawn, none will be drawn otherwise.
b
boolean indicating if a shoulder line has to be drawn.

true if the printed background has to be white, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Treat the events sent by the CorrelationThread instances.

The correlograms are retrieve in case the data have changed (an other view has changed its parameters) as all the views are sharing the same data.
event

The correlograms are retrieve in case the data have changed (an other view has chaneg its parameters.

briefdescription.para: Creates a thread which will get the correlations information for the pairs of clusters contained in pairsToCompute due to the clusters in clusterIds.

parameterdescription.para: couple of clusters for which a correlogram has to be obtained.
clusters for which the correlograms will be computed.

briefdescription.para: Draws the correlograms of the pair of clusters in the list pairList on the given painter.

parameterdescription.para: painter on which to draw the correlograms.
list of pair of clusters for which a correlogram has to be drawn.

briefdescription.para: Updates the dimension of the window.
Asks the correlograms for all the clusters currently shown by launching a CorrelationThread.
Draws the clusters identifiers.

parameterdescription.para: painter on which to draw the information.

briefdescription.para: View displaying auto- and cross-correlations of all selected clusters.

detaileddescription.para:
Using the text boxes in the Parameter Bar, the user can modified the bin size and duration used to compute the correlograms. All modification request is sent directly to the KlustersDoc object and the view is automatically updated via KlustersView when the correlograms have been changed. If the view is active, it is also automatically updated when clusers are changed.
Lynn Hazan
